In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    result = ""
    current_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
            current_length += 1
        end
        result *= word
        current_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return result
end
```
This function splits the input string `s` into words and for each word, it checks whether adding it to the existing line would exceed the specified text width. If so, it starts a new line. Otherwise, it adds the word to the current line separated by a space if necessary.

Here is an example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt"))
```
The output will be:
```shell
Lorem ipsum 
dolor sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit. Sed do 
eiusmod tempor 
incididunt
```
